pullRequest.body:
Add the definition `CategoryTheory.Enriched.IsConicalLimit` of conical limits in enriched ordinary categories.

Co-authored-by: Emily Riehl <eriehl@jhu.edu>
Co-authored-by: Dagur Asgeirsson <dagurtomas@gmail.com>

---

- [x] depends on: #20903
- next PR: #20907
- next PR: #20959
- full content: #20967
- source: emilyriehl/infinity-cosmos#78

<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

</details>

<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#20903~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Im closing this in favour of the reimplementation at #22921

I think `V` should be an explicit parameter to `IsConicalLimit`. (This is what we have in the rest of the enriched category API, and I believe it should not change.)
Could you also add references to the mathematical literature? and also some minimal API (like constructors which under suitable assumptions may take as input only the `isLimit` field, or only the `isConicalLimit` fields?)
To be more precise, for the API I am suggesting, I do not think we would have to assume `HasLimitsOfShape J V` as in #20905.

You are right, `outParam` is not needed here, only in some `class`es in a later PR. Restructrued the file.

I don't think I understand how `HasLimitsOfShape J V` could be dropped?

We have a notion of preservation of colimits/limits which does not assume the existence of colimits/limits (https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/CategoryTheory/Limits/Preserves/Basic.html#CategoryTheory.Limits.PreservesLimit). Then, if `eCoyoneda` preserves certains limits, we may obtain `isConicalLimit` from `isLimit`.

- added reference.
- see other comment for continued discussion on preservation & existence of limits

```suggestion
    suffices limit.post F (eCoyoneda V X) =
      ((eCoyoneda V X).map ((limit.isLimit F).conePointUniqueUpToIso hc).hom) ≫
        limitComparison V c X from this ▸ inferInstance
    apply limit.hom_ext
    simp [limitComparison, ← eHomWhiskerLeft_comp]
```
Others might have the opposite preference, though.

took almost this but used 
` by rw [h]; infer_instance` instead of `this ▸ inferInstance`

```suggestion
    ((h.isConicalLimit X).conePointUniqueUpToIso (limit.isLimit _)).hom :=
  limit.hom_ext (fun _ ↦ rfl)
```
This suggests there is a missing API: `Functor.mapConeIso` in `CategoryTheory.Limits.Cones`.

In order to get better integration with mathlib (and possibly avoid some duplication of API between limits and conical limits), I would suggest the following design:
```lean
class HasConicalLimit (F : J ⥤ C) extends HasLimit F : Prop where
  preservesLimit_eCoyoneda (X : C) : PreservesLimit F (eCoyoneda V X) := by infer_instance

attribute [instance] HasConicalLimit.preservesLimit_eCoyoneda
```
This would make the whole limit API available under the stronger assumption `HasConicalLimit`.
I think that the `IsConicalLimit` structure should play a much smaller role: basically, it should be used only as a structure that can be fed to a constructor for `HasConicalLimit`:
```lean
structure IsConicalLimit extends IsLimit c where
  isConicalLimit (X : C) : IsLimit <| (eCoyoneda V X).mapCone c

variable {c} in
lemma IsConicalLimit.hasConicalLimit (h : IsConicalLimit V c) :
    HasConicalLimit V F where
  exists_limit := ⟨_, h.toIsLimit⟩
  preservesLimit_eCoyoneda X := preservesLimit_of_preserves_limit_cone
    h.toIsLimit (h.isConicalLimit X)
```

With this, some basic API results can be obtained easily:
```lean
lemma hasConicalLimit.of_iso {F' : J ⥤ C} (e : F ≅ F') [HasConicalLimit V F] :
    HasConicalLimit V F' where
  toHasLimit := hasLimitOfIso e
  preservesLimit_eCoyoneda X :=
    preservesLimit_of_iso_diagram (eCoyoneda V X) e
```
thanks, I'll look into that that tomorrow
@joelriou is this (together with the weakened assumption in `variable [HasLimit (F ⋙ eCoyoneda V X)]` below) what you meant in the other comment?

Yes, but the more idiomatic way would be:
```lean
  isConicalLimit _ := isLimitOfPreserves _ hc
```

**[lint-bib (comment with "bot fix style" to have the bot commit all style suggestions)]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion language = {English} ```

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory/Enriched/Limits): Add conical limits for enriched ordinary categories
